page.title: 05Farm life in Cumbria
page.content: There are 15 farms in the block, varying in size from 50 - 250 acres. Of these 12 are owner-occupied and the remainder have different landlords. These family farms are very self sufficient, none employs outside labour except on a part-time basis. Half have contractors in to make silage, 2 go out silage contracting, and 2 do combining. They have to buy in concentrates and perhaps beet pulp and barley straw. Some rent summer grazing land. Sons and daughters work on the family farm when they leave school. They will learn their craft from day courses at the local farm school at Newton Rigg. The Young Farmers Club will provide both education and a busy social life for them up to the age of 26.
